title: Battery Times
question_text:
A recent experiment was performed involving $150\text{ generic batteries}$ and $150\text{ brand-name batteries}$. The designers of the experiment used each battery for a fixed task and determined how many trials the battery could perform before it died.
The results are presented in the boxplots below.
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

About how many of the batteries lasted more than $200\text{ trials}$?
solution:
Based on the boxplots, brand-name batteries have a 3rd quartile of about
200
 trials
.

Therefore, about
150
⋅
0.25
=
37.5
of these batteries last more than
200
 trials
.

Generic batteries have a first quartile of about
200
 trials
.

Therefore, about
150
×
0.75
=
112.5
of these batteries last more than
200
 trials
.

37.5
+
112.5
=
150

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
